title: Erfaren teknisk testare till Tre
description:
Teknikavdelningen på Tre omfattar cirka 300 medarbetare och teamet "Services" är en del av IT Development-organisationen. Vårt fokus är att ansvara för bland annat centrala funktioner, så som autentiseringsflöden, betalningslösningar och integrationer för både externa partners och våra interna behov.
   

  

 Services-teamet består av 19 personer som alla delar samma mål: att skapa större synergier i våra lösningar för att bättre stötta både den svenska och danska verksamheten!
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som teknisk testare på Tre arbetar du tätt ihop med andra testare, utvecklare och kravanalytiker utifrån ett agilt arbetssätt med kontinuerlig leverans. Du blir tidigt involverad i kravprocessen för att säkerställa att kravet är testbart. I denna roll kommer du att ha det övergripande ansvaret för hur teamet testar samtidigt som du själv är aktivt involverad i det operativa testarbetet.
   

  

 I dina dagliga arbetsuppgifter ingår planering, exekvering och uppföljning av tester. En betydande del av arbetet är kommunikation inom och utanför teamet kring koordinering av test. Vidare ingår i rollen att testa i Postman, SQL Developer och testning av integrationer. Våra testscripts är skrivna i unix shell script och jmeter. Vi arbetar i Jira och Confluence för att stödja och förtydliga våra processer. Vår teknikstack består bland annat av Java, Spring Boot, REST, SOAP, CI/CD, Jenkins, Selenium och Playwright.
   

  

 I arbetet ingår även att kontinuerligt förbättra arbetssätt, strategier, processer, metoder och verktyg. Du kommer att märka att vi har ett effektivt, prestigelöst och lösningsorienterat arbetssätt.
   

  

**Du kommer se fram emot att**
* vara del av en lärande kultur där vi erbjuder dig en utmanande miljö där du lär dig nya saker och bidrar med din kompetens
* bredda dig inom din roll och vara med i vår resa där ny teknik och funktionalitet ständigt levereras
* vara en del av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser enligt Great Place To Work samt att vi är topprankade hos Karriärföretagen av IT-Young Professionals
* tillhöra en arbetsgivare som vill bidra till att kvinnor vill välja och stanna kvar inom teknikbranschen, vi är stolta partners till Women in Tech och Tjejer Kodar


**Lite mer om dig**
 Du är en person som brinner för test i en agil IT-miljö och ser till att säkerställa kvalitet ur ett större perspektiv. Vidare är du kommunikativ, strukturerad, bra på samarbete och har ett naturligt driv i att få saker gjorda. Det ligger i din natur att agera proaktivt och ständigt arbeta med förbättringar.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen behöver du flera års erfarenhet av testautomatisering av framför allt integrationer/APIer och backend, samt end-to-end testning. Vidare har du erfarenhet av att jobba i team där testautomatisering är en naturlig del av utvecklingsprocessen. Du behöver ha goda kunskaper i engelska i skrift och tal då vi jobbar i en internationell miljö. Det är en bonus om du pratar och förstår svenska.
   

  

**Din ansökan**
 Ansökan till rollen sker via denna annons (ej e-mail) och vi vill antingen att du connectar med din Linkedin eller skickar ditt CV. Personligt brev behövs inte, men vi vill gärna att du svarar på de frågor vi ställt nedan i samband med att du söker.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Tech Lead for Customs & International, – Solna/Hybrid
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
*PostNord is an important and sustainable part of society. We are humble in the face of the responsibility that rests on us, and proud of our knowledge and implementation ability. Are you the specialist or key person to solve the challenges we face? Can you demonstrate that you can lead architectural and design decisions while guiding team members in technical matters? Together, we create an innovative culture that drives development. For this, we seek a talented Tech Lead within our Customs Nordic Management team.*
 You, Us & The Job
   

  

 As Tech Lead for the Customs Nordic area in our logistics organization, you will be operating in the Production area of PostNord IT landscape, focusing on developing and maintaining Customs solutions. You will work in a diverse environment, and collaborate with the Customs Solution Architect, the Customs Tech Lead, The Customs Expert, Business Analysts and the development team, partly in the Nordics, but also in India.
   

  

 Nevertheless, the business and various development teams, to understand business needs and deliver high-quality, scalable, and secure software solutions.
   

  

 What will you do?
   

  

 As member of the Nordic Customs Management (NCM) team, you will be assisting the Product Owner in transforming Epics into Features, Features into User Stories etc. into technically understandable terms. Helping to design and suggesting solutions for our customs processes and for integrating with the SaaS solutions involved in the Nordic Customs solution. Making sure that solutions meet the process and user requirements for the customs solutions and suggesting improvements. Engaging in projects, sharing knowledge, and helping break down integration requirements, to successfully secure flows end-to-end in the customs flows. Taking part as developer of integration solutions where possible.
   

  

 Who are we looking for?
   

  

 We are looking for you, who want to drive excellent software development and integration in our Customs area, while ensuring best practices, such as quality and security, are followed in all stages of the product development life cycle. You, who want to combine technical expertise, while guiding and mentoring, the team, engineers and associate engineers, in using best practices in software engineering to ensure high-quality, scalable, and maintainable code. Nevertheless, securing that the application itself is stable and secure.
   

  

 You take initiative, start activities, achieve results, and have an interest and have the willingness to help others and strive to contribute with technical expertise to projects, promoting the use of best practices in software engineering.
   

  

 You have good communication skills, and like collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand user needs and develop robust software solutions.
   

  

 You have a problem-solving mindset and have analytical skills to identify signs of degradation or risk that will cause impact to the business and to promote a plan of action to maintain quality service. In other words, how to deal with debt, and driving technical excellence and innovation within the team, while encouraging the use of new technologies and methodologies.
   

  

 Your Experience
   

  

* Proven experience (3+ years) and previous working experience with Customs in the Nordic/SE as e.g., Customs administrator, Customs Expert, User of Customs systems.
* Working in a multi-cultural, multi-sourced environment/team.
* Skilled in communication.
* Experience working in the logistics industry, the customer segments, and the market.
* Business domain knowledge of logistics processes across domains and countries.
* Experience and/or knowledge of
+ o Nordic customs and customs systems

* Knowledge of customs business flows


 (Nice-to-have)
   

  

* Experience of any framework for agile scaling at enterprise level (e.g. SAFe, LESS etc.).
* Strong knowledge of the logistics industry, the customer segments, and the market trends.


**Technical Expertise**
* Knowledge of modern solutions in Cloud and microservice architecture. Familiar with streaming data (e.g. Kafka).
* Understanding data management practices, data modelling, and database design is important, hereunder PostgreSQL and Oracle DB knowledge.
* Good understanding large datasets and ensure data integrity and security.
* Experience working with JavaScript Frameworks
* Familiar with containerization in OpenShift
* Knowledge of some of the integration technologies used in PostNord. E.g., API, Tibco.


**Language Requirements**
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
* Proficiency in at least one Scandinavian language is meritorious.


**Education**
* University degree or similar relevant education in technology/IT or equivalent work experience in relevant areas.


 We offer you
   

  

**About**
 We are a modern, customer-oriented company that cares as much about our employees as we do about our customers. With us, you are offered a varied job in an international environment with constant new challenges and quick decisions. In addition to fair employment conditions according to collective agreements, we offer you:
   

  

* Flexible hybrid workplace. Watch the film about our office.
* Great development opportunities
* Great insurance and occupational pension terms
* Wellness allowance & opportunity to train at Arken's gym and indoor swimming pool
* Employee benefits through PostNord Plus - PostNord´s own personnel foundation


**About Us**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are in a constant transformation and work consistently to develop both our offer and our employees, all to achieve our vision of being The favorite carrier of the Nordics. We are PostNord - a fantastic company to work and grow with. Read more at group.postnord.com
   

  

 Apply
   

  

 Welcome to submit your application. The selection is ongoing, so please apply as soon as possible. If you have any questions or concerns, please email nikoletta.revesz.gudmann@postnord.com or call +45 20997861.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 Read more about our union representatives

title: SharePoint-utvecklare
description:
Drivs du av att utveckla appar och funktioner i SharePoint? Vill du lära dig mer och utvecklas i din roll? Hos oss blir du en del av ett självgående team som jobbar med både standard- och egenutvecklade funktioner.
   

  

 Janina, SharePoint-specialist och blivande kollega berättar:
   

  

* Pensionsmyndigheten är verkligen en plats där du kan trivas och växa. Här har jag upptäckt ett fantastiskt team som arbetar mot samma mål och stöttar varandra på vägen. Alla är så hjälpsamma och kunniga – dessutom har vi roligt tillsammans!


 Pensionsmyndigheten är en myndighet som ligger i framkant när det handlar om teknik och utveckling. IT-avdelningen består idag av ca 350 medarbetare och växer kraftigt för att möjliggöra genomförandet av pensionsgruppens överenskommelse om långsiktigt höjda och trygga pensioner. För oss inom IT innebär detta nyutveckling under många år framöver, av ett flertal nya pensionsförmånssystem - med den senaste tekniken och arbetssätt. Som en del av vår IT-avdelning kommer du att verka i en innovativ miljö präglad av stort driv där nya idéer välkomnas.
   

  

 Visionen är satt: Bäst IT för Sverige 2025!
   

  

 Arbetsbeskrivning
   

  

 Vi är ett jämställt team som ansvarar för ytor och applikationer som är byggda på plattformen. Fokus ligger på att modernisera och leverera förenklade lösningar för våra användare.
   

  

 Vi använder idag SharePoint 2019 och kommer börja migrera till SharePoint Subscription Edition (On-Premise).
   

  

 I teamet finns djup SharePoint kompetens inom alla delar (support, utbildning, utveckling och infrastruktur). Hos oss kommer du få möjlighet att utvecklas.
   

  

 Vi har ett öppet klimat där vi delar med oss av kunskap till varandra, ser till helheten och arbetar enligt ramverket SAFe.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter och ansvarsområden tillsammans med dina kollegor är att:
   

  

* Utveckla och uppdatera funktioner i SPFx
* Presentera framtagna lösningar för att fördjupa kunskapen i och utanför teamet
* Avveckla gammal kod


 Utbildning och erfarenhet
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har minst ett års erfarenhet av att utveckla på SharePoint plattformen och har viljan att utvecklas, ta nästa steg i din roll.
   

  

 Du har erfarenhet av:
   

  

* SPFx
* React, TypeScript, Rest API


 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:
   

  

* Git, Bitbucket eller motsvarande
* C# och CSOM
* PowerShell
* Migrering inom SharePoint plattformen
* Erfarenhet inom annat område inom SharePoint (ex. förvaltning)


 All dokumentation sker på svenska varför det är viktigt att du behärskar svenska språket väl i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Egenskaper
   

  

 Vi vill att du har ett eget driv till lärande, tar initiativ och har ett lösningsorienterat förhållningsätt. Du har också god förmåga att samarbeta och kommunicera.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och lämplighet för rollen.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder
   

  

 Ett myndighetsuppdrag som är viktigt på riktigt! En arbetsplats där vi värnar om att våra medarbetare ska ha en god balans mellan arbete och fritid. Vi tillämpar hybridarbetssätt med möjlighet till distansarbete och på kontoret utifrån en överenskommelse med arbetsgivare. Som statligt anställd har du även goda anställningsvillkor och ett förmånspaket med friskvård, flexibel arbetstid, lediga klämdagar samt goda semester- och pensionsvillkor.
   

  

 Övrigt
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning och vi förbehåller oss rätten att tillämpa provanställning om 6 månader vid behov. Tjänsten placeras i Stockholm.
   

  

 Vårt kontor i Stockholm ligger i Hornstull nära tunnelbanan, där vi sitter i ljusa och moderna lokaler.
   

  

 Anställningen kan komma att placeras i säkerhetsklass.
   

  

 I denna rekryteringsprocess behöver du inte bifoga personligt brev, däremot vill vi att du besvarar de frågor som du får ta del av när du skickar in din ansökan och som ligger till grund för det första urvalet.
   

  

 Arbetspsykologiska tester eller färdighetstester kan komma att ingå som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 Vi strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning och ser mångfald som en styrka och välkomnar därför sökande med olika bakgrund. IT-avdelningen driver sedan en tid tillbaka ett initiativ för att öka medvetandegrad och fokus på jämställdhet.
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter kontakta rekryterande chef som hjälper dig med din ansökan.
   

  

 #VårtJobbBerörAlla
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: PSL 2024-89 | Kontakt: Caroline Uhrbom 0104542022, | Facklig företrädare: Anna-Karin Åhrman Cortelius, Saco-s 010-4543914, Helena Blomkvist, ST 010-4542853, | Publicerat: 2024-09-20 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-10-27

title: iOS Software Engineer
description:
#### **Join Telavox as an iOS Engineer!**

We are looking for a talented and driven iOS Engineer to join our mobile team in Malmö. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone with a passion for mobile development, cutting-edge technology, and creating impactful solutions in the telecom industry.


If you’re excited about working with Swift, solving complex challenges, and contributing to a fast-growing, innovative company, we’d love to hear from you!

#### **About the job**


As an iOS Engineer at Telavox, you'll be working on our companion app that enables customers to use our professional telephony services in a simple and intuitive way. You’ll collaborate with a cross-functional team of developers and UX designers to ensure a seamless experience for users. Our multi-platform approach gives you the chance to collaborate with professionals in various technologies and work alongside our strong backend systems.


A typical day in this role involves:

* **iOS architecture and development:** Utilizing Swift to develop and maintain the app, ensuring seamless integration with RESTful backend services and a focus on user experience.
* **Assisting team members:** Collaborating to solve problems, improve existing features, and create new ones with usability and performance in mind.
* **Continuous development and improvement:** Engaging in code reviews, retrospectives, and team discussions to enhance the app and team workflow.
* **Managing App Store reviews and releases:** Handling the build and delivery process for app deployments, ensuring quality and timely updates.


This role is based in our Malmö office, where you’ll join a collaborative, dynamic work environment with fellow mobile developers. You’ll have the opportunity to contribute to shaping the future of our mobile offerings in an ever-evolving tech landscape.

#### **About you**


We’re looking for an iOS Developer with a minimum of 4 years of experience in software development and at least 2 years focused on iOS. You thrive in a collaborative environment, are passionate about mobile technology, and are eager to stay up-to-date with the latest in iOS development.

### **Technical competencies:**

* Proficiency in **Swift** and **SwiftUI**
* Exposure and interest in **Java**
* Experience with **Fastlane** and **CI/CD** pipelines for iOS apps
* Strong knowledge of **Apple's Human Interface Guidelines** and **AppStore Review Guidelines**

### **Good-to-have skills:**

* Familiarity with **Objective-C** and experience or interest in **Kotlin/Android development**
* Experience with **CallKit**

### **Super-nice-to-have skills:**

* Experience with **webRTC, SIP/pjsip**


You’ll fit right in if you love agile development, enjoy problem-solving, and bring a positive, can-do attitude to everything you do. We value curiosity, self-management, and the ability to laugh and collaborate with your peers to deliver top-quality results.

#### **Why Telavox?**

Since Telavox's journey started in 2002, we have strengthened our position as the leading forward-thinking communication platform for businesses. We offer Telephony, PBX, messaging, meetings, and contact centers in one simple platform. Unlike our competitors, we own our platform and develop everything ourselves in-house.

  

Today, we are a fast-growing and profitable company with +1.9b in revenue, +500 Telavoxers in nine countries, and +160 people working in Product and Engineering.


We pride ourselves on creating an inclusive, supportive culture where everyone can thrive. By joining us, you will not only contribute to our technology but also be part of a company that values work-life balance, continuous learning, and community. Plus, you will enjoy our legendary company events, personal development opportunities, and much more

  



### **Are you interested in becoming part of Telavox? Apply now!**


At Telavox, we don't focus on fitting in; we focus on making room for everyone.


Join Telavox, where diversity fuels innovation. Apply now to join a team committed to creating a truly inclusive workplace.


Do not miss out on this exciting opportunity to grow your career and make your mark on the future of telecom technology. Send your application our way, and let us explore what we can achieve together!


For any questions, feel free to reach out to Talent Acquisition Partner Ami Faraguna at ann-marie.faraguna@telavox.com

**Learn more about what we do! ️**

title: Senior UI Designer (12 month FTC) | Candy Crush Saga
description:
**Craft:**
 UX & UI
   

  

**Job Description:**
 Are you ready to take our players on an incredible journey? Do you aspire to create the world’s best mobile games? We are seeking UI talent to help us level up and ensure our games are as inclusive and engaging as possible. You’ll drive our team forward to deliver unforgettable experiences that delight players across the world.
   

  

 Your role within our Kingdom
   

  

 As an experienced and talented Senior UI Designer, you’ll work closely with UX and game designers, user researchers, developers, game artists and technical artists. Collaborating with internal stakeholders, UI lead and producers, you will work on the effective and optimised user interface systems and new player-centric features for Candy Crush. With your passion for interaction and communication design, you’ll help us to apply design principles in practice and proactively share your knowledge with other UI designers and game artists.
   

  

 As a member of the Candy team you’ll participate in a cross-location collaboration. We believe your communication and organisation skills will help you to champion our cooperation on features and information exchange among the teams.
   

  

 Skills to create Thrills
   

  

* You have experience in UI design for games
* Experience in UI implementation with game engines
* You have a well-developed sense of visual aesthetics
* You have knowledge of technical constraints and assets optimisation
* You can apply interaction and communication design to your work
* You are confident in analysing design specs
* You are a proactive and reliable team player


 Bonus Points
   

  

* Skills in animation, motion design and special effects
* Experience working in an agile project environment
* Passion for mentoring and supporting the growth of others


 A portfolio demonstrating all aspects of your skill, including any relevant personal projects, is required.
   

  

**About King**
 At King, we're Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We're the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world's most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren't just crushing it with candies, we're also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was acquired by Microsoft.
   

  

**A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes**
 King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.
   

  

**Making the World Playful**
 Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?
   

  

 Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.
   

  

 So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.
   

  

 Applications need to be in English.
   

  

 Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Android-utvecklare
company_industry: Civil Engineering, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens retaillösningar och appar för självscanning på ICA Sverige? Vi söker nu en Androidutvecklare med gedigen erfarenhet och passion för nativeutveckling. Hos oss får du chansen att arbeta i en kreativ och tekniskt avancerad miljö, där dina omfattande kunskaper och erfarenheter står i fokus.
   

  

 Om jobbet som Androidutvecklare
   

  

 I den här rollen kommer du att vara en central spelare i utvecklingen av mobila lösningar som stödjer ICA:s självscanning, både i vår app och i handhållna enheter. Du arbetar nära ett erfaret team bestående av Androidutvecklare, UX/UI-designers, backend-specialister, Delivery Lead och testare och du är med från idéstadiet till färdig produkt.
   

  

 Vem är du?
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har omfattande erfarenhet av Android-utveckling i Kotlin, med stark kompetens inom Jetpack Compose, Android Views, och MVVM-arkitektur. Du har arbetat med Kotlin Coroutines och API-hantering med OkHttp, och är van vid att felsöka nätverksanrop med Proxyman eller Wireshark. Erfarenhet av Git/GitHub och CI-verktyg som Bitrise är ett krav, och du skriver enhetstester med JUnit som en naturlig del av utvecklingsprocessen.
   

  

 Erfarenhet av Kotlin Multiplatform och arbete med hårdvara som NFC-läsare eller liknande är ett plus.
   

  

 Arbetsspråket är svenska så du behöver känna dig bekväm med att arbeta på både svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Vad händer nu?
   

  

 Har du frågor kring tjänsten kontakta Amanda Näsman, rekryterande chef på 072-220 10 11. Vid frågor om process eller urval kontakta Markus Öhman, rekryterare på 070-695 62 04.
   

  

 Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt dock ej senare än 20 oktober. Vi jobbar med löpande urval och intervjuer och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

 ICA ska spegla våra kunder och samhället, vi strävar därför efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund, kompetenser, kunskap och erfarenheter. Vi värnar om goda arbetsmiljöförhållanden med mål om helt rökfria arbetsplatser. Om roller kräver det så behöver du genomgå tester, bakgrundskontroller och drogtestning innan anställning.
   

  

 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på ICA.

title: System programmer
description:
**Description**


HV Breakers är i en branch som växer i en rasande takt och vi ser en långsiktig utbyggnad av elektrifiering globalt.


Eftersom vi jobbar med program och system till Orderkonstruktion samt Säljorganisation så är vi en viktig del i deras verksamhet.

**Dina och teamets ansvarsområden**

* Konfigurator för Säljorganisationen: Vi underhåller en konfigurator som är en viktig del när man bestämmer hur kunden vill ha brytaren designad.
* Ritningsgeneratorer: Konfiguratorn är i sin tur kopplad till ritningsgeneratorer, vilka vi också underhåller, som skapar måttskisser samt skyltritning baserat på hur man konfigurerat apparaterna.
* Konfigurator för ERP system: Vid en order så exporteras säljkonfigurering till vårt ERP system som via sin inbyggda konfigurator skapar en BOM för apparaten. Detta underlag tillsammans med ev. kompletterande kundkrav har Orderkonstruktion som en grund för att göra ett komplett underlag för både ritningar till kund samt materialbehov till Inköp.
* Kretsschemagenerator: Vi underhåller även en ritningsgenerator för att ta fram kretsschemor som vi ser en stor potential att utveckla och integrera med vårt ERP system.

**Din bakgrund**

* Du har en teknisk utbildning med minst en kandidatexamen.
* Lätt för att samarbeta med andra.
* Duktig på att förstå och skriva i varierande programspråk.
* Erfarenhet från liknande verksamhet är en merit.
* Du uppskattar ett gott samarbete inom gruppen samt med våra användare för att få en sund och flexibel IT-miljö.
* Du talar och skriver såväl svenska som engelska obehindrat.

**Vad vi erbjuder**

* Kollektivavtal
* Flexibel arbetstid
* Hälso- och friskvårdsbidrag
* Fantastiska karriärmöjligheter inom Hitachi Energy både i Sverige och globalt
* Mentor som stöd under introduktionsfasen
* Olika utbildningar och kompetensutveckling för anställda
* Mångfaldigt företag med över 70+ nationaliteter som arbetar i Sverige
* Extra ersättning för föräldraledighet
* Förmånsportal för anställda med tusentals rabatter och förmåner

**Mer om oss**


Vi är intresserade av att lära oss mer om dig och vad du kan bidra med, så tveka inte att söka!

  

Ansökningarna kommer att granskas löpande, så vänta inte – ansök redan idag!

  

För frågor rörande tjänsten vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Jan Ruthström, jan.ruthstrom@hitachienergy.com. Fackliga företrädare - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Philip Bengtsson, +46 107-38 25 17; Unionen: Michael Fosselius, +46 107-38 46 19; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43. Övriga frågor kan ställas till Talent Acquisition Partner Michael Blomberg, michael.blomberg@hitachienergy.com

title: Commerce Architect
description:
At our Song Commerce Customer Tech team, we are passionate about delivering transformative commerce experiences across the full customer lifecycle. As part of a globally renowned consultancy, we combine strategy, technology, and delivery excellence to help clients navigate the complex world of commerce. Our dedicated team of consultants specializes in advising on cutting-edge technologies and solutions tailored to meet our clients’ unique business needs, ensuring measurable outcomes.

**About the Role**


As a Commerce Architect, you will play a pivotal role in bridging the gap between business strategy and technical execution. You will leverage your deep expertise in commerce technologies and architecture to design comprehensive solutions that not only meet immediate business needs but also align with long-term goals. This role requires both technical acumen and strategic thinking, as you’ll be responsible for guiding the architectural direction of commerce projects while also working closely with business leaders and technical teams to ensure the success of every solution.

  

You will engage across the full project lifecycle—from early-stage solution design to post-implementation reviews—providing thought leadership and technical guidance. Your role will also involve contributing to business development efforts, supporting client Requests for Proposals (RFPs) with your knowledge of commerce technologies and architecture strategies.

 **Key Responsibilities**

* Design commerce solutions: define the long-term vision and strategic direction for commerce solutions, conducting in-depth analyses to identify opportunities, challenges, and constraints throughout the solution lifecycle.
* Stakeholder collaboration: partner with business stakeholders and technical teams to elicit, understand, and clarify both functional and non-functional requirements. Ensure that solutions align with the business’s strategic objectives while addressing immediate needs.
* Architectural leadership: provide expert guidance in shaping solution architecture by translating business needs and technical requirements into detailed architectural blueprints. Assess and explain trade-offs between different design options, focusing on scalability, performance, and alignment with business objectives.
* Component selection: evaluate and recommend the right components for the architecture, whether they are off-the-shelf products or bespoke solutions. Compare options based on fit-for-purpose, cost, scalability, and time-to-market.
* Assessment and optimization: assess existing solutions, identifying gaps, inefficiencies, or opportunities for improvement. Provide actionable recommendations to elevate performance, security, and user experience.
* Solution development leadership: collaborate closely with engineering, development, and delivery teams to ensure that the solution is implemented according to the architectural design, adhering to both business goals and IT standards.
* Roadmaps and transition architectures: develop and maintain solution roadmaps and transition architectures that account for current technology landscapes while planning for future enhancements and emerging technologies.
* RFP support and business development: actively contribute to business development by supporting client RFPs with your understanding of commerce architectures, providing innovative solutions and technical expertise that align with client goals.
* Mentorship and knowledge sharing: serve as a mentor and thought leader within the organization, sharing best practices, fostering architectural thinking, and providing coaching to cross-functional teams.

  

**Professional Requirements**

* Commerce expertise: minimum of 2+ years of experience designing and delivering large-scale commerce solutions (B2B or B2C), with a focus on core business capabilities such as content management, customer identification, product management, search and recommendations, checkout, and payment.
* Technical integration: experience with system integration, ensuring seamless interactions between various commerce components. Proficient in working with API-driven architectures, data flows, and system interoperability.
* Performance and security: proven experience optimizing site performance and ensuring reliability, with an understanding of Content Delivery Networks (CDNs), caching mechanisms, and cyber security best practices.
* Composable commerce: familiarity with composable commerce landscapes, understanding how to integrate microservices, headless architectures, and cloud-native technologies to build flexible and scalable solutions.
* Cloud platforms: experience working with major cloud platforms such as Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), or AWS, ensuring that cloud-native solutions are fully leveraged for performance, scalability, and cost-effectiveness.
* Commerce platforms: knowledge of some leading commerce platforms (e.g., SAP Commerce, Salesforce Commerce, Adobe Commerce, Shopify, Spryker, Commercetools), as well as related capabilities such as Content Management Systems (CMS) like Adobe, Contentful, or Contentstack, and Product Information Management (PIM) systems such as Akeneo or Inriver.
* Solution architecture: demonstrated ability to develop solution architecture blueprints, driving the execution of solutions in multi-product team setups. Ability to take ownership of the architectural vision and provide clear direction throughout the project lifecycle.
* End-to-end delivery: experience managing the full lifecycle of solution delivery—from initial concept through design, build, deployment, and post-go-live maintenance.
* Technology trends: stay updated on the latest commerce technologies and industry trends, incorporating emerging technologies to enhance solution capabilities and create future-proof architectures.
* Education: bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, information technology, software engineering, or a related field.
* Agile mindset: experience working in cross-functional teams with an Agile approach, using methodologies such as Scrum or DevOps to foster collaboration and flexibility.
* Languages: fluent in English, both written and spoken.
 **Personal Attributes**

* Customer-centric focus: demonstrate a customer-first mentality, keeping the end-user experience top of mind when designing and recommending solutions.
* Collaborative and proactive: a team player who actively engages with colleagues, shares knowledge, and contributes to a positive working environment.
* Communication excellence: ability to communicate complex technical concepts in a clear and compelling manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Adaptability: open to feedback, always seeking to improve, and willing to adapt your approach to fit new challenges.
* Quality and reliability: strong focus on delivering high-quality solutions that are reliable, scalable, and sustainable over the long term.
* Leadership and mentoring: ability to lead by example, offering guidance and mentorship to junior colleagues and contributing to a culture of learning and growth within the organization.
**Make your move now**


Please send your detailed CV. We are continuously evaluating the applications.

title: Network Programmer
description:
Overview:

MachineGames is growing and we are now looking for a talented Network Programmer to join our studio!  

In this role your job is to tackle the game networking layer and we believe the person that will be best suited for this job is already experienced with real-time and low-latency object replication.
You will be working in our programming department that is a diverse, passionate group of people that loves the game industry, just like the rest of our studio!  

Our studio is located in central Uppsala, Sweden which is a small and vibrant city 40 minutes north of the capital, Stockholm. It has a historical heritage reaching back to pre-medieval times.  

Our studio has a legacy of being down to earth and free from big egos, our everyday work as well as our long-term goals are driven by our values:* *We value Team performance over individual performance*
* *We practice an open door policy*
* *We deliver what we promise*
* *We give constructive and actionable feedback*
* *We practice ownership and accountability*
* *We learn from our mistakes.*

  

This is a permanent position starting as soon as possible. The role is onsite with the option to work in a hybrid capacity at either or HQ in Uppsala or our satellite office in Sundsvall. We will support your relocation and/or application for work permit if you don't have one or are not an EU citizen and/or are not currently residing in Sweden.  


Responsibilities:
* Architect and implement features in C/C++, that is CPU, GPU and memory efficient, with an eye to a quality end-user experience.
* Develop, extend and debug network and gameplay code while respecting platform and design constraints.
* Measure and optimize performance and bandwidth of the networking layer.
* Collaborate well with programmers and other disciplines involved in the day to day work.
* Review code written by programmers across the studio and collaborate with them to improve code quality.
* Help mentoring less experienced team members.
* If required, debug, modify, extend or use the tools pipeline as necessary.
* Construct solutions for unforeseen design problems in a timely manner.
* Proactively provides suggestions on how to utilize new technologies and tools and implement them into our workflow.


Qualifications:
* Demonstrate and apply strong problem-solving and debugging skills in C++.
* Write clean, professional, well commented and maintainable code.
* Show good knowledge of mathematics for 3d game development.
* Understand a large set of the many components that makes up a modern video game and show capabilities of independently take on tasks.
* Have experience from a full cycle of a AAA game production.
* Experience with networked gameplay and object replication in a client-server model.
* Knowledge about low-level networking communication using UDP/TCP and related technologies.
* Excellent verbal and written communication in English.
* Lastly, you are passionate about games!


Preferred Skills:
* Knowledge and understanding of online matchmaking services.
