title: Specialist Road and Railway Plans
company_industry: Civil Engineering and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**We are winning exciting and challenging assignments! To meet the market's demand, we need more colleagues with a focus on road and railway plans. Our work on road and railway plans is ongoing in both large and small projects, and the planning process is a central part of many of our assignments. Are you our new colleague?**







  




**DEVELOP WITH US IN CIVIL**







  




 In COWI Sweden, there are three divisions: Civil, Industry & Buildings and Digital & Management. Within Civil, we primarily work in the business areas of Urban Development and Infrastructure, with specialists in areas such as roads, railways, traffic, landscape architecture, geotechnics, water & drainage, BIM, construction management, project management, climate, and sustainability specialists. Projects are planned and implemented with a multidisciplinary perspective in close collaboration across both technical and departmental boundaries. Assignments range from early stages and investigations to design and maintenance.
   

  








  




 Civil is located in Malmö, Skövde, Helsingborg, Gothenburg, and Stockholm and has about 350 driven and committed employees. We have a really good community, and the atmosphere is characterized by humility, collaboration, and a familial, open atmosphere where we all work towards common goals with a focus on future sustainable urban development projects.
   

  








  




**Your role**







  




 You will primarily work to coordinate and develop our road and railway plans and be responsible for their progress and implementation. The role is central in our planning assignments, closely tied to the project management. The work involves close collaboration and dialogue with the client and its external stakeholders, as well as internal collaboration with other technical areas. You will work in national projects across Sweden as well as projects in your local market. You also have the opportunity to act as a project manager or technical manager in other projects depending on your experience and expertise.
   

  








  




**Your profile**







  




 We are looking for someone who is committed, motivated, and communicative. Your expertise is key to our success.
   

  








  




  For the position, you need to meet the following criteria:
 





* • You have experience of leading the plan process for rail and/or road projects for Trafikverkets projects.
* • You have a good understanding of the Swedish Transport Administration's planning process regarding formal handling and legal matters.
* • You have at least five years of relevant work experience and several years of experience in working with road and railway plans.
* • You have relevant education in within the civil engineering area, alternatively, you have extensive work experience in the field.
* • Fluent in speaking and writing Swedish and able to communicate well in English.



  




**A place to work and so much more**







  




 At COWI, we work together with our customers to shape a sustainable and liveable world. We do it by applying our knowledge and curiosity - and sometimes even our courage - to create the solutions the world needs today to enable a better tomorrow. That is why we say no to fossil-based projects and aspire to have 100% of our revenue come from activities that move our customers towards sustainability.
   

  








  




 We value differences and development and cultivate an environment of belonging and having fun. Because that is what brings out the best in you, at work and at home.
   

  








  




 With offices primarily located in the Nordic region, the UK, North America and India, we are currently 8,000 people who bring their expertise in engineering, architecture, energy and environment into play.
   

  








  




**Do you have more questions?**







  




 At COWI, we strive for diversity among employees, so we welcome a variety of applicants. We look forward to receiving your application for a developing and exciting job with us in Civil!
   

  








  




 If you want to know more about the position or the recruitment process, please do not hesitate to contact Andreas Fredriksson, Head of Discipline Mobility and Urban Planning, +46 722097603.
   

  








  




 If you want to apply, apply directly via the link.
   

  








  




**How to apply**







  




 We would like to hear from you, apply via the link. Apply as soon as possible as the position can be assigned before end date.
   

  








  




**Equal Opportunities for All**







  




 At COWI, we value equal opportunities for all employees and applicants based on individual circumstances without regard to gender, gender identity, gender expression, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability, or age.

title: Lean Portfolio Analyst till Agria
description:
*Vill du vara i centrum för en spännande digital transformation i ett företag som förenar avancerad teknik med djurens välmående? Som Lean Agil portföljanalytiker (LPA) hos Agria får du möjligheten att leda förändring och innovation i en roll där dina analytiska färdigheter spelar en avgörande roll för företagets framgång.*
**Om jobbet**
 I rollen som Lean Agil portföljanalytiker kommer dina ansvarsområden vara följande:
   

  

* Analysera och sammanställa portföljens status ur finansiella, resursmässiga och värdebaserade perspektiv.
* Säkerställa att portföljdata är korrekt och kontinuerligt uppdaterad.
* Förbereda och sammanställa beslutsunderlag för våra styrande forum.
* Följa upp och analysera mål och KPI:er för utvecklingsportföljen.
* Stödja och vidareutveckla våra portföljstyrningsprocesser.
* Stödja och leda Agrias Epic Owners och andra intressenter för att främja en effektiv utveckling.


 Du kommer att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö där du dagligen utmanas, utvecklar din expertis inom agil portföljhantering och bidrar till att forma framtidens djurförsäkringar. Du ingår i vår grupp för Leverans- och Utvecklingsstyrning och är en del av vårt lean-agila portföljstyrningskontor. Här stöttar du vår tågledning, våra Epic Owners och andra ledande personer i vår utvecklingsleverans.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 För att bli framgångsrik i denna roll ser vi att du:
   

  

* Har en akademisk examen och en god förståelse för styrning och uppföljning av agil IT-utveckling.
* Minst två till tre års erfarenhet av portföljstyrningsfrågor eller PMO-stöd i större transformationsprogram, gärna inom en lean-agil kontext, exempelvis SAFe.
* Erfarenhet av att analysera affärscase samt hantera både tekniska och praktiska komplexa samband.
* Utmärkta kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


 Det är även meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Kännedom om försäkringsbranschen.


 Som person är du analytisk och har en stark förmåga att lösa komplexa problem. Du är en skicklig kommunikatör som kan förmedla komplexa idéer på ett lättförståeligt sätt. Du är utvecklingsinriktad, flexibel och öppen för förändring, med erfarenhet av förändringsarbete inom större företag och organisationer. Du motiveras av att göra det svåra enklare och mer lättillgängligt.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Välkommen till Agria Djurförsäkring – en plats där vi skapar trygghet för djur och människor. Allt vi gör, gör vi för djuren. Det genomsyrar hela vår medarbetarkultur och märks i alla beslut vi fattar. Vi tror på att människor med en genuin passion för djur är nyckeln till att förmedla vårt erbjudande och att upprätthålla våra mål, mission och löften.
   

  

 Vi vill bidra till en kreativ och lärande miljö där du som vill utveckla dig själv och verksamheten ska kunna göra det. En miljö där vi som arbetsgivare ger dig rätt stöd och ledarskap. Tillsammans skapar vi en inkluderande arbetsplats att trivas i och vi välkomnar alla, oavsett bakgrund.
   

  

 Agria växer i Europa och har idag verksamhet i Sverige, Norge, Finland, Danmark, Storbritannien, Tyskland, Frankrike, Irland och Nederländerna. På Agria arbetar cirka 650 medarbetare. I koncernen ingår även dotterbolaget Agria Vet Guide som erbjuder digital veterinärrådgivning.
   

  

 Var med oss på resan att skapa Europas största och mest valbara djurförsäkringsbolag för att skapa trygghet för fler djur och människor.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-11-01**

title: Category Head of Smoke Free Products
description:
**Join us to deliver a smoke- free future as Category Head of Smoke Free Products!**
 We’ve chosen to do something incredible. We’re totally transforming our business and building our future on one clear purpose – to deliver a smoke-free future. Swedish Match is an affiliate of PMI and have been a leader in the industry for more than 200 years.
   

  

 In the Nordic region, we are 1,600 employees based in Sweden, Denmark, Finland and Norway working in various functions and teams and together we are collaborating to deliver a smoke-free Nordics.
   

  

 We are looking for a Category Head of Smoe Free Products (SFP) who will be the owner of Heat not Burn (HnB/IQOS) and Vape (VEEV) categories in the Nordics and be part of the Marketing and Digital leadership team. The incumbent is ultimately accountable for delivering brand awareness, consideration, and intent to buy, embedding the global brand guidelines in the local markets, and producing, trans-creating and deploying omni-channel toolboxes, content, events and other consumer engagement interventions. Additionally, the role is responsible to deliver a fit for purpose portfolio strategy and launch plan, supported by a promotional calendar and pricing proposition.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities**
* Lead local brand building for IQOS and VEEV and embed brand guidelines in all commercial programs, projects and initiatives.
* Participate in commercial programs, projects and initiatives providing deep brand and content expertise, from idea generation to GTM (go-to-market) and omni-channel execution.
* Develop, own and project run the execution of the market brand communication plan and editorial calendar.
* Accountable for the market content creation and management for Smoke Free Products (SFP) brands, products, accessories, consumables and services, across all channels and touchpoints (offline and online), in collaboration with channel leads.
* Accountable for the market portfolio plan, including optimization, monitoring of performance, new and limited edition launches and promotional initiatives’ calendar.
* Accountable for the market content creation and management for Smoke Free Products (SFP) brands, products, campaigns, events, accessories, consumables and services, across all channels and touchpoints (offline and online), in collaboration with channel leads.
* Handle external marketing agencies, suppliers and partnerships.
* Lead a dedicated team and work with other departments and agencies to drive teh development and growth of our brands.


**Requirements**
* University degree in Business administration / Marketing
* 5+ years of experience in commercial leadership roles in a muti-category environment
* 7+ years of experience in developing and implementing comprehensive marketing strategies that effectively enhance brand awareness
* Prior experience leading large and diverse teams in a fast-paced and very competitive environment
* Ability to inspire and drive direct and cross-functional teams towards shared goals
* Experience designing, leading and managing consumer-centric campaigns to build and strengthen brand equity and drive increased awareness
* Solid experience managing and leading diverse marketing campaigns across various platforms, including digital, social media, email, and traditional channels
* Experience with developing brand content strategies for offline/online communications
* Ability to understand business environment, consumer behaviors, and trends and translating them into meaningful and scalable consumer and trade programs


**What We Offer**
 Our success depends on the dedicated people who come to work every single day with a sense of purpose and an appetite for progress. Join us at Swedish Match and you too can:
   

  

* Seize the freedom to define your future and ours. We’ll empower you to take risks, experiment and explore.
* Be part of an inclusive, diverse culture, where everyone’s contribution is respected; collaborate with some of the world’s best people and feel like you belong.
* Enjoy flexibility of hybrid way of working - split your time between working from our office or the comfort of your home, where it works best for you in line with business needs.
* Pursue your ambitions and develop your skills with a global business – our staggering size and scale provides endless opportunities to progress.
* Take pride in delivering our promise to society: to deliver a smoke-free future.


 #SWMA
   

  

**2121**

title: Director Accounting & Compliance
description:
Acne Studios is a progressive luxury house and through collaboration and curiosity, we set high aspirations and strive for excellence. We value everyone's contribution and embrace feedback to develop ourselves and others. We aim to minimise our environmental impact across all our operations and to address societal challenges in the way we conduct our business.
   

  

 CULTURE OF COLLABORATION
   

  

 We firmly believe that when you feel supported, included, and trusted, it enables you to enjoy your work and thrive in it. You will be a part of a team of colleagues with diverse roles and backgrounds, each with their unique skills and experiences.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 As Director Accounting & Compliance your main contribution will be to manage all matters related to international accounting, group accounting and compliance for all Acne Studios entities and the Acne Studios Group. With your team you ensure accurate financial reporting and maintain regulatory compliance within the organization. You will report to the CFO.
   

  

**You Will Ensure Financial Integrity And Compliance By**
* Leading & managing the accounting teams in Stockholm HQ and in the markets
* Managing the monthly and annual closings and related reporting
* Providing guidance on accounting and compliance (internal control) matters for the group
* Managing the cash flow and providing cash flow forecasts
* Maintaining and enforcing a functioning internal control system
* Being the first contact for auditors, tax advisors and external auditors (tax, customs)
* Coordinating and facilitating the creation of permanent establishments in new markets


**Who You Are**
 You have high aspirations and focus on details that create substantial impact. You enjoy working as a team and you embrace feedback to develop yourself and others. You are curious and thrive in a dynamic environment. Cooperation, respect, and clear communication are important, along with your ambition to learn and grow. If these qualities speak to you, we would love to have you on our team.
   

  

**Specific Personal Qualities For This Role**
* You guide your team through challenging situations with confidence, making decisive actions to meet goals and deadlines
* You approach challenges with a strategic mindset, quickly grasping how financial decisions impact overall business performance and proactively finding ways to enhance efficiency and profitability
* You collaborate effectively across departments, ensuring everyone is aligned and informed to achieve a shared outcome
* You maintain oversight of complex operations, ensuring that all components work together to support broader objectives
* You anticipate future challenges and delegate tasks efficiently to keep the team prepared and focused
* You build a supportive, open environment where feedback is welcomed and constructive guidance is given


**Specific Experience And Knowledge For This Role**
* Several years of experience in a similar position, ideally in a globally operating group
* Excellent communication skills in English facing different audience
* Good knowledge in Microsoft 365


 We are dedicated to recognising the potential in each individual. We embrace diversity of people as well as ideas and viewpoints and encourage everyone's individual expression of their own identity.

title: Solution Sales Executive - ESG & Sustainability - Nordics
description:
The
 **Solution Sales Executive** 
 is responsible for obtaining new business and customer expansion sales opportunities from Executive-level buyers and influencers in either private or publicly traded companies. Solution sellers are focused on a specific portfolio of Workiva solutions and collaborate with other Workiva sales teams to deliver multi-solution sales.
   

  

 Successful candidates will build relationships and identify Workiva products and solutions that meet customer needs to drive customer acquisition within an assigned territory. Sales growth is attained through new customer subscriptions, professional services, delivery and training.
   

  

 This role will focus on Workiva's ESG & Sustainability solutions for the Nordics Corporate market.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Actively seek out sales opportunities in collaboration with peer Sales teams, Inside Sales, and Partnerships to generate qualified sales pipeline
* Utilize information gathered during the needs analysis phase to deliver a compelling demonstration of the Workiva platform
* Skillfully address customer objections - removing obstacles - and finding solutions to various client challenges
* Lead the sales process naturally - guiding it to a close by effectively showcasing Workiva's value proposition
* Regularly and promptly update customer relationship management tools to report customer contacts
* Provide consistent and accurate forward-looking information through pipeline analysis to forecast sales
* Develop and execute a sales strategy with purposeful action to secure the sale
* Rally internal support to pursue an account and optimize internal resources
* Prioritize selling activities and ensure timely follow-through
* Maintain a strong understanding of Workiva products through a commitment to ongoing training and a growth mindset


**What You'll Need**
 Minimum Qualifications
   

  

* 4+ years experience in a related role - enterprise technology or similar complex solution sales
* Undergraduate Degree or equivalent combination of knowledge and related career experience


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Understanding of the Software as a Service (SaaS) business model
* Ability to demonstrate complex software applications
* Strong business acumen and an ability to understand complex business challenges
* Executive presence and an ability to communicate at the most senior level
* Ability to identify and understand the power of influencers versus buyers and how to navigate the nuances of each during the sales cycle.
* Ability to manage multiple complex sales cycles simultaneously
* Ability to negotiate pricing with a focus on retaining value
* Capability for achieving (and exceeding) sales quota targets


**Travel Requirement & Working Conditions**
* Up to 30% travel for regular customer meetings and events
* Reliable internet access required for any period of time working remotely and not in a Workiva office


 Workiva is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that great minds think differently. We value diversity of backgrounds, beliefs, and interests, and we recognize diversity as an important source of intellectual thought, varied perspective, and innovation. Employment decisions are made without regard to age, gender identity, race, religion, disability status, sexual orientation, or any other protected characteristic.
   

  

 Workiva is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. To request assistance with the application process, please email talentacquisition@workiva.com.
   

  

 Workiva employees are required to undergo comprehensive security and privacy training tailored to their roles, ensuring adherence to company policies and regulatory standards.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**About The Role**
**Important note:** 
 Please remember to include your grade transcript along with your CV when submitting your application.
   

  

**The team** 
 : Our team consists of 8-10 engineers and is responsible for an application for delivery of optimization services for large financial institutions. We value working with passionate, talented and nice people who have fun together while pushing ourselves and our systems to improve continuously. Our architecture is clean and modern and based upon patterns like automated testing, modulation, clear boundaries and clear responsibilities, and we believe in continuous and iterative delivery, fail fast, prototyping and continuous feedback from internal and external clients.
   

  

**The impact** 
 : OSTTRA is a FinTech company at the heart of the global financial system, dedicated to building the future of post-trade. We keep our eyes on the horizon, always on the lookout for new possibilities and opportunities while staying with our feet on the ground, making sure we deliver rock-solid services that our clients rely on for their daily business and success. Our optimization services create distinct positive impacts on client portfolio risk profiles and operational costs. When our services are executed, global metrics of systemic risks in the financial markets improve significantly. Long-term value to the client is the most important goal of our team, and your contribution in the form of delivery, improvements and innovations can have a significant impact on the financial system.
   

  

**What’s in it for you** 
 : We strongly believe in individual growth and have long experience in guiding early careers engineers in our modern approach to software production, which includes:
   

  

* Rapid, iterative and phased delivery, backed by automated testing and deployment frameworks.
* Streamlined, autonomous and independent teams, optimized and supported for fast change.
* Clean architecture for maintainable, scalable, and flexible code, aligned with the team structures and with clear boundaries and responsibilities.
* Innovative culture with a strong focus on exploration and prototyping, where failing fast is a virtue which drives technological and product improvements.


**Software Engineer Position Profile**
 We are seeking a passionate and talented individual to join our innovative and forward-thinking team as a Software Engineer during the summer of 2024. Our company is at the forefront of rapid, iterative, and phased delivery, backed by cutting-edge automated testing and deployment frameworks. We believe in streamlined, autonomous, and independent teams that are optimized and supported for swift adaptability. Our commitment to clean architecture ensures maintainable, scalable, and flexible code, aligned with team structures and defined responsibilities.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 As a Software Engineer, you will contribute to the success of our projects using your focus, talent, passion, and grit. We are looking for candidates who hold a Master's degree in Computer Science or have equivalent education or background, and have 3-5 years of relevant work experience. We foster an innovative culture that places a strong emphasis on exploration and prototyping. Here, failing fast is seen as a virtue, propelling technological and product improvements.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Collaborate with cross-functional, autonomous teams for rapid and phased delivery.
* Uphold clean architecture principles to ensure code maintainability, scalability, and flexibility.
* Contribute to an innovative culture through exploration, prototyping, and a willingness to take calculated risks.
* Engage in continuous learning to stay abreast of the latest technologies and industry best practices.


**Qualifications**
* Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent background.
* 3-5 years of relevant experience.
* Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for learning.
* Demonstrated ability to work effectively in an autonomous and collaborative environment.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to contribute ideas to a diverse team.


 If you are a tech enthusiast with a thirst for innovation and a desire to contribute to an exciting and fast-paced environment, we invite you to apply for this position. Join us as we redefine the boundaries of technology and drive impactful change in the industry.
   

  

**About OSTTRA**
*Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.*
 OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.
   

  

 With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.
   

  

 Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.
   

  

 Learn more at www.osttra.com.
   

  

**What’s In It For** 
**You?**
**Benefits**
 We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
   

  

**Our Benefits Include**
* Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
* Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
* Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
* Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
* Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
* Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.


 For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
   

  

 If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.
   

  

**US Candidates Only:** 
 The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law.

title: Senior Power System Engineer for Power Consulting Sweden
company_industry: Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Share this job
   

  

  

  

 Seize this opportunity to take on a highly visible position in a global organization. As a Senior Power System Engineer you will belong to Power Consulting, a department within Hitachi Energy working with both internal and external clients in the energy sector. You will be part of a renowned global team of power system and energy consultants. In the role, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the green transition and create a more sustainable energy future for all.
   

  

 So, if you want to take the next step in your career, and contribute to develop a stronger, smarter, and greener energy system – Join us now! We are interested to learn more about you and what you can contribute with so don’t hesitate to apply even if you don’t meet all the requirements. A team with great cooperation and with diverse backgrounds is waiting for you to join it!
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* In this exciting role, you will get the opportunity to take part in major assignments related to the green energy transition together with our consultants and experts from local as well as international Power Consulting offices.
* The assignments for the role are mainly system studies within the area of HVDC, FACTS, renewable energy integration, green hydrogen and power systems in general.
* As a Senior Power Systems Engineer, you are expected to take lead in assignments towards clients and to mentor junior colleagues.
* Cooperation and work in teams with leading specialists together with Hitachi Energy well-defined career path ensures exciting and motivating career with fast development along own interests and personality traits.
* You will be living Hitachi Energy core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.


**Your background**
* You hold a Master’s degree in electrical engineering, electrical power systems or similar.
* You have a great interest and at least three years of experience in the consulting and energy sector.
* Knowledge in power systems analysis and in software simulation tools such as PSS/E, PSCAD and/or DIgSILENT PowerFactory.
* Programming skill in Python, C++, etc. is a merit.
* You have an analytical mindset, you are independent, self-going and take your own initiatives to solve problems.
* As a person, you are collaborative and communicative.
* It is necessary to be fluent in English. Swedish is meritorious.


**What We Offer**
* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks
* More benefits could be connected to this specific role


**More About Us**
 The position is based in Gothenburg or Stockholm (Solna).
   

  

 We are interested to learn more about you and what you can contribute with so don’t hesitate to apply even if you don’t meet all the requirements. A team with great cooperation and with diverse backgrounds is waiting for you to join!
   

  

 Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so don’t delay – apply today!
   

  

 Recruiting Manager, Joachim Andersson, joachim.x.andersson@hitachienergy.com, will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives – Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 25 73; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85. All other questions can be directed to Talent Partner, Tobias Nilsson, tobias.n.nilsson@hitachienergy.com.
   

  

 Apply now
   

  

 Location Goteborg New, Sweden;
   

  

 Solna, Stockholm, Sweden Job type Full time Experience Experienced Job function Engineering & Science Contract Regular Publication date 2024-09-20 Reference number R0060971

title: Executive Assistant, Stockholm
company_industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
We are looking for a dynamic Executive Assistant to work alongside our CEO, with the aim to make their day-to-day life more effective. This is a role for someone who thrives in an ever-changing environment and is as comfortable with high-level responsibilities as they are with everyday operational tasks.
   

  

**We Believe You Are**
* Humble & Adaptable: You are willing to roll up your sleeves and do whatever is needed - from managing high-profile meetings to handling more essential daily tasks.
* Insightful & Proactive: You’re quick on your feet, able to assess situations, anticipate needs, and offer solutions before problems arise.
* Great Communicator & Socially Adept: You communicate clearly and professionally, and you build strong relationships with both internal and external stakeholders. You know how to connect with people at all levels, balancing professionalism with empathy.
* Service-minded: You take pride in providing support, whether it's for the CEO or the wider team, and you genuinely enjoy helping others succeed.
* Integrity: You have integrity and work confidently with C-level executives, handling sensitive information with discretion and trust.


**What You Will Do**
* Email & Calendar Management: Keep the CEO’s inbox organized, prioritizing important messages and ensuring everything is followed up on. Ensure the calendar is up-to-date and optimized.
* Board and executive support: Help set up board meetings, manage communication with board members, and prepare any necessary documents.
* Travel Arrangements: Handle travel plans, including booking flights, finding places to stay, and putting together travel itineraries.
* Expenses: manage expense reports.
* Logistics & Events: Coordinate meetings and logistical arrangements.
* Proactive planning: Review future schedule and tasks for the CEO on a regular basis to ensure everything is properly prepared and arranged in time for all meetings and events.
* Personal Tasks: Occasionally assist with the CEO’s personal tasks, treating them with the same level of professionalism and care as work-related duties.
* Support for broader exec team: Occasional support for other tasks as needed by other members of the executive team.


**We Believe You Have**
* 3-4 Years of Experience: You have experience as an Executive Assistant, ideally working with senior executives in a fast-changing environment. If you’ve supported executives in the tech or SaaS industry, that’s a big plus. Experience is important but we will put a lot of emphasis on personality.
* Organizational Excellence: You’re a natural multitasker who loves keeping things organized, structured, and prioritized. You are detail-oriented and take pride in managing your own and other’s tasks with efficiency.
* Excellent Communication Skills: You are clear, concise, and professional in all forms of communication. Whether it’s sending emails, coordinating with board members, or managing logistics.
* Tech-Savvy: You’re proficient in tools like Google Workspace, and project management platforms and communication tools (e.g., Slack, Notion, Miro)
* Flexibility: You’re comfortable shifting between different tasks and priorities, whether it’s arranging travel, board meetings, or handling personal errands.
* Fluency in Swedish and English: Ensuring effective communication, both verbal and written, with diverse stakeholders.


**Who We Are**
 → Take a look at our
 **Funnel benefits** 
**!**
 Funnel is a Swedish-founded company with headquarters in Stockholm. Our SaaS product is designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Sydney and Hamburg offices.
   

  

 We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data.
   

  

**Other Information**
 This role is located in our Stockholm office. We have an office-first approach and we value increased in-person collaboration and as such, we work the majority of the time from the office.
   

  

 We currently do not sponsor work visas and therefore we will take into consideration only applicants who:
   

  

* Hold Swedish citizenship
* Hold EU/EEA citizenship
* Have a valid work permit for working in Sweden

title: Technology Sales Representative
description:
**Job Description**
 We are seeking a highly experienced Senior Sales Executive to lead the strategic expansion and sales efforts of Oracle Technology Software solutions to both new and existing customers. In this role, you will be responsible for identifying growth opportunities, building strong relationships with key stakeholders, and driving business development initiatives to increase market share. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of success in enterprise software sales, deep knowledge of Oracle's technology stack, and the ability to articulate the value of Oracle solutions in solving complex business challenges.
   

  

 You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including product management, marketing, and customer success, to ensure alignment with customer needs and corporate objectives. As the Senior Sales Executive, your responsibilities will also include leading negotiations, closing high-value deals, and developing comprehensive sales strategies to meet and exceed revenue targets. Additionally, you will stay updated on industry trends, competitor offerings, and market dynamics to position Oracle's products as the preferred solution in the market.
   

  

 This is a highly visible leadership role, offering the opportunity to make a significant impact on the business while contributing to the continued growth and success of Oracle Technology Software solutions.
   

  

 Key responsibilities include:
   

  

 Building and maintaining relationships with C-level executives and decision-makers within target accounts
   

  

 Developing and executing strategic sales plans to achieve revenue and growth objectives
   

  

 Managing the full sales cycle, from prospecting and lead generation to closing deals and ensuring customer satisfaction
   

  

 Partnering with internal teams to align product offerings with customer requirements
   

  

 Staying ahead of industry trends and competitive offerings to drive innovation and differentiation
   

  

 If you are a results-oriented sales professional with a passion for technology and a deep understanding of Oracle's ecosystem, we encourage you to apply and join our dynamic team.
   

  

 Career Level - IC4
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 Primary job duty is to sell technology software products and related services in a defined territory. Identifies, qualifies and closes new opportunities. Manages accounts including the entire sales process from business development prospecting and specifications through contract negotiations, signing, and post-sales support. Leverages the Oracle sales model to maximize revenue growth and increase local market share. Builds and expands business partner revenue and self sufficiency.
   

  

**About Us**
 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.
   

  

 When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.
   

  

 We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.
   

  

 Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
   

  

 We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.
   

  

**Disclaimer:**
 Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer\*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.
   

  

* Which includes being a United States Affirmative Action Employer

title: Data Center Regional Mechanical Engineer (Field Engineering), Field Engineering
description:
***This job is with Amazon, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
**Description**
 As an Amazon Field Engineer, you will provide full life-cycle support to AWS Data Centers from design inception through site improvement and maintenance. You will be the 'go to' engineering resource for your region when technical advice is needed, and will use your subject matter expertise and engage with diverse teams to:
   

  

* Perform design and equipment submittal review for new Data Centers in your region.
* Troubleshoot, conduct Root Cause Analysis (RCA) and create Corrective Action (CA) documentation for site/equipment failures.
* Directly support operational issues with ad-hoc training, complex operating procedure reviews, including critical equipment, and event support.
* Own the conceptual design for existing data center upgrades and design-solutions, which add capacity, improve availability, increase efficiency and sustainability.
* Interface with internal data center operations team, data center design engineering team, server hardware team, environmental health and safety team to promote standards that maintain consistency and reliability in services delivered.
* Develop innovative solutions for AWS's data centers.
* Work on concurrent projects, sometimes in multiple geographical regions.
* Initiate and lead engineering audits including on-site visits within Amazon's data centers. Produce reports outlining risks with recommended mitigations and remediations.
* Act as resident engineer during new construction projects. Support construction, commissioning, and turnover.


 AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we're the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain - and we're looking for talented people who want to help.
   

  

 You'll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You'll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you'll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

**Role**
 Amazon's vision is to be the world's most customer-centric company, and this role is key to that vision. As a Field Engineer, you will be leading projects to fit out our data centers to meet ever-evolving customer needs as we continue expanding our fleet to hyper-scale. As an ideal candidate you:
   

  

* Possess Strong Engineering Judgement and are able to provide recommendations despite uncertainty/ambiguity.
* Are detail and data oriented.
* Have experience solving problems with engineered solutions.
* Have experience managing engineering projects and consultants.
* Build trust and relationships with different stakeholders (e.g., Operations, Controls, Construction, Design, Commissioning, Product Managers, Technical Program Managers, ).
* Are adaptable and inclined to get into the field to see things up close. Excited about a mix of office and field work.


 A day in the life
   

  

 Each day you will interact with different teams responsible for all aspects of the data centers. You will prioritize your activities to support data center capacity availability and safety focusing on the actions that are most impactful. You will have the opportunity to work on projects locally and globally.
   

  

 If you meet these qualifications, exude passion, and enjoy the challenge of innovative projects at hyper-scale, this job is for you!
   

  

**About The Team**
 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating - that's why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it's in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We're continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth's Best Employer. That's why you'll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there's nothing we can't achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn't followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don't let it stop you from applying.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent experience.
* Experience with data center, or similar industry, mechanical equipment, including but not limited to AHUs, CRAHs, DX units, Generators, Pumps, Evaporative Cooling


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Coursework in commercial/industrial mechanical systems with experience with psychometric theory, calculations and practical application
* Organized and have the ability to set priorities and meet deadlines and budget
* Possess leadership and problem-solving skills. Possess excellent communication and writing skills, attention to detail, maintain high quality standards
* Experience using a variety of web based and other software tools for calculation and data processing.
* Meets/exceeds Amazon's functional/technical depth and complexity for this role


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

title: Arkitekt inom Edge & IoT på TechSeed
description:
*På TechSeed är vi övertygade om att det är tekniken som kommer göra världen till en bättre plats. Vi ser ett stort behov i vårt samhälle att kombinera affärsförståelse, digitalt ledarskap samt innovativa arbetssätt och lösningar med framtidens tekniker i uppkopplade ekosystem. Vi tror på en hållbar framtid med säkra lösningar genom exempelvis IoT-lösningar, digitala tvillingar, AI och cybersäkerhet. Det här är vårt WHY och det fyller oss med energi varje dag. Det här är vår arena.*


TechSeed är ett medarbetarägt bolag som erbjuder konsulttjänster och har ett kompetensdjup inom flera domäner. Vi är på en kraftig tillväxtresa och söker nu lösningsarkitekter som även kommer få en stor grad av inflytande och insyn i hur vi växer framåt och tar ett helhetsgrepp om uppkopplade ekosystem och lösningar. Vi söker dig som trivs i konsultrollen och samtidigt vill bidra till att skapa vägen framåt för TechSeed – Tillsammans.


Som **Lösningsarkitekt** kommer du arbeta som konsult i samarbete med kund. TechSeed strävar efter att kunna erbjuda en blandning mellan placering hos kund och projekt som leds av TechSeed. Respektive uppdrag sätter förutsättningarna och det förväntas att du är bekväm med båda alternativen.


I den här rollen kommer du tillhöra enheten TechSeed Edge & IoT Göteborg, vars fokus sträcker sig från vision till leverans av uppkopplade system. IoT och IIoT handlar till stor del om att fånga datapunkter från verkligheten, en verklighet där kundernas utmaningar omfattar helt olika processer och verksamheter. Kanske är det du som sätter lösningsarkitekturen för fastighetsbolaget som önskar styra värme, vatten och ventilation mer hållbart. Kanske handlar ditt nästa uppdrag om att lösa insamling av mätdata i maritim miljö med utmaningar i såväl miljö, uppkoppling, underhåll och energiförsörjning. Edge syftar på bearbetning av data nära källan, vilket styrs av krav på säkerhet, bandbredd och underhåll. Som lösningsarkitekt ansvarar du för att fånga kundens krav, önskemål, möjligheter och utmaningar, samt såklart ta fram en lösningsarkitektur. Det förutsätter en teknisk bredd och ett nära samarbete med kund.


Som delägare och anställd kommer du vara med i utvecklingen av våra erbjudanden, få möjlighet att påverka de områden som du drivs av och samtidigt få tryggheten av ett team med gemensamt mål och gemensamma intressen.


Vår grund ligger i att vi delar med oss av vår passion för teknik och värdet vi skapar. Det handlar bland annat om kunskapsutbyte och att dela idéer, bidra med god stämning såväl som att skapa värde genom vårt delägarskap. Vi erbjuder dig:

* Inflytande i hur vi bygger TechSeed tillsammans
* En öppen kultur där vi värdesätter olikheter, insikter och innovationer
* Direkt värde från våra finansiella resultat genom bonus och delägarskap
* Möjligheten att växa in i olika tekniska områden / ansvarsområden utifrån dina önskemål
* Flexibelt arbete hemifrån, beroende på uppdragets behov.

**Vem söker vi?**


Vi söker dig vars expertis är lösningsarkitektur inom IoT / IIoT. Du förväntas ha bredd i dina tekniska kunskaper och god förståelse för hur tekniska lösningar, protokoll och plattformar bör kombineras för att möta kundernas behov. Några exempel på teknik och begrepp från vår vardag; AMQP, AWS/GCP/Azure IoT, Bluetooth, CoAP, DDS, DevOps, Digital Twin, HMI, IT/OT, Linux, LoRaWAN, LTE CAT, LwM2M, Machine Learning, MES, Modbus, MQTT, NB-IoT, ONNX / PyTorch / Cuda, OPC UA, PKI, PLC, PROFINET, SCADA, Sparkplug, Wi-Fi, ZigBee.  

  

Om delar av ovan är en ingår i din vokabulär, verktygslåda och fångar ditt intresse - hör av dig!


Du är såklart nyfiken på ny teknik, trivs i roller där du utvecklas och i en kultur där vi hjälps åt och bygger bolaget **tillsammans**. Du har minst 5 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet, är självklart lösningsorienterad och trivs i samarbete med kund. Eftersom vi arbetar med flera typer av kunder med olika behov kräver rollen att du kan uttrycka dig obehindrat på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift. Det är även meriterande om du har erfarenhet av att jobba på ett start/scale-up, har tidigare konsulterfarenhet eller relevanta kunskaper från industrivertikaler och marknadsområden.

**Om TechSeed**


Vi är ett medarbetarägt konsultbolag i ScaleUp-fasen med visionen att skapa värde med uppkopplade lösningar. Vi tror på kombinationen av nära samarbeten, framtidens tekniker och att gemensamt arbeta för att skapa ett bolag vi verkligen trivs på. Genom att erbjuda delägarskap till våra anställda ger vi möjligheten till insyn och påverkan, samtidigt som det gynnar samarbeten och att prioritera vad som är bäst för gruppen. Detta speglas både i vår kultur och våra erbjudanden, där vi kombinerar vårt stora tekniska intresse med ett kundanpassat förhållningssätt samtidigt som vi har många sociala aktiviteter och en härlig gemenskap på kontoret. Vår arena är uppkopplade ekosystem, där tekniker som IoT och Intelligent Edge används för att skapa uppkopplade tjänster och system inom ekosystem som Smart Cities, Smart Factories, Smart Companies och Smart Buildings.

title: Solution Engineer
description:
We are looking for a **Solution Engineer** for a company in **Skövde.**


What are the responsibilities of a Solution Engineer? Well, let’s try to dig into that!


The company perceives, that in the role Solution Engineer you work in close co-operation with Stakeholders and translate the business needs into requirements for the IT solution. The requirements might need support from the development team of the IT-solutions or be hands-on configuration changes in the setup of the IT-solutions. You will be part of the team that performs these configurations and implement the changes in the factory. The team operates in a global environment, where they together with the company factories make sure, that the production critical IT-solutions important for manufacturing, works according to expectations.


The company is in a transformation towards a more agile, product focused way of working, where the goal is to work with shorten time to market for the applications. Are Your ready for a challenge and to be part of the Vision and journey towards a more Agile setup?

**Who is we are looking for?**


The company is looking for someone who has a passion for understanding the needs of the customer and getting the details right. Teamwork is a great part of the daily work – therefore you should be a team player and appreciate an open environment for discussions and dialogue. As person you are analytical, structured and communicative.


You should have an agile mindset and feel a strong commitment in delivering with high quality. **They especially welcome female applicants,** since they do want to be an even more diverse group than they are today!


**Required knowledge/experience:**

* University degree in Computer Science, Development or similar
* Experience from working with Agile, DevOps or similar methodologies.
* Experience from automotive industry is an advantage.
* Experience from working with Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES), Virtual Device (VD), Shop floor applications, PLC-communication is a good merit.
* Knowledge in IT Test activities is an advantage.
* SQL knowledge is good to know.
* Excellent spoken and written English.
* Valid work-permit for Sweden if not a citizen, please include this information when applying.
* Being a truly open-minded and curious person.

**Your main focus will be to:**

* Understand customer needs, in close cooperation with them.
* Become an expert of the IT-applications and the way they operate in the factories.
* Support roll-out and upgrade activities for the solutions in a global environment.
* Support the factories with IT-specific knowledge.


This is a full-time consultancy position through Incluso in Skövde. Start is in November, one year limited contract to begin with, possibility of extension after that.


For more information, please contact Kanika Singhal @ kanika@incluso.se, recruiter at Incluso.

title: Senior Data Fabric Engineer
description:
We are Sinch. Join us and be a part of a global leader in Communication Platforms as a Service (CPaaS) and mobile customer engagement. With presence in more than 60 countries, we enable businesses to reach everyone in the world, through mobile messaging, email, voice, and video.
   

  

 We believe equal opportunities are the key to our success. No matter who you are, you'll be able to explore career options, face captivating challenges, and build skills alongside outstanding people.
   

  

****The essence of the role****
 We are seeking a Senior Data Fabric Engineer to build, maintain, and support data infrastructure that powers our all products worldwide. In this role, you will be a part of our Data Fabric team, responsible for overseeing our data infrastructure. Your blend of infrastructure expertise and data skills will ensure our operations run smoothly.
   

  

 This role is based in Stockholm, Sweden, functions under a hybrid model, and reports to the Engineering Manager.
   

  

**As Our Senior Data Fabric Engineer, You Will**
 As a member of our team, you will develop and maintain our data fabric, and craft robust monitoring solutions to ensure healthy and stable production systems. You'll also play a crucial role in continuously enhancing the fabric with new capabilities to meet evolving business needs. Your expertise in developing powerful, scalable, and maintainable data infrastructure solutions will be essential to the success of our data operations at Sinch.
   

  

* Lead technically and in align with business counterparts.
* Mentor colleagues and foster a culture of collaboration.
* Define, plan, and implement solutions for arising needs.
* Collaborate with other parts of the data organization and R&D to optimize and improve existing solutions.
* Drive innovation with your expertise and proactive approach.


****Who are you?****
* An experienced professional with 3-6 years of senior-level capacity in Data Engineer, Site Reliability Engineer (SRE), or Platform Engineer.
* Software background is a plus.
* Expertise in cloud data platforms.
* Knowledgeable in one of the big three cloud providers (GCP, AWS, Azure).
* Proficient in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and DevOps procedures.
* Skilled in Snowflake, Databricks, Informatica.
* Strong communication and mentoring.
* A problem-solver with a strong analytical mindset.


****Ready to chase your dreams?****
 Submit your application in English and join us in making seamless and impactful connections worldwide. Be part of our dynamic data team that promotes growth and embraces hybrid work.
   

  

 At Sinch, we value learning, adapt to change, and offer opportunities for personal and professional development. Unfortunately, we are currently unable to support relocation outside the EU at present, therefore, we welcome applicants who hold a Swedish or EU/EEA citizenship or have a valid work permit for Sweden.

title: Software Developer
description:

title: Backend developer, Solna
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Are you a passionate developer who wants to make a difference in people's everyday lives?
   

  

 PostNord develops innovative consumer services for a smoother delivery experience. Our services are used by millions of customers daily via PostNord’s web and app.
   

  

 We work agile in a DevOps culture with modern technologies with great opportunities to influence technology choices and working methods forward.
   

  

**You Will, Among Other Things, Work With**
 Improve the customer experience at checkout and contribute to making PostNord the preferred shipping option. Develop and improve live tracking and Estimated Time of Delivery (ETA) services for home, parcel locker and service point deliveries, so our customers can plan their day with precision. Develop our internal backend system used for calculating PostNords routes including development and maintenance of internal websites.
   

  

**Your profile**
 To be successful in this role we believe that you are curious, driven and have a strong eager for constant learning and development of new skills.
   

  

 But also experience in;
   

  

* Java, all the way from REST interface to the database
* New development of services where you have been part of design, architecture, requirements, development, testing, commissioning in production and maintenance after launch. Spring Boot, Docker & Kubernetes, and AWS are a big plus.
* Agile working methods and according to DevOps principles.
* CI/CD and management of Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
* Monitoring tools such as Prometheus and Grafana


 We also see that you have,
   

  

* Academic education in computer science or equivalent experience.
* At least 5 years' relevant working experience.
* Fluent English in speech and writing.
* It is an advantage if you have experience in e-commerce and logistics.


**We offer you**
* To work with our modern tech stack and you are given great opportunities to influence the choice of technology.
* Hybrid workplace with a Nordic and dynamic environment. Watch the video about our office
* We encourage you to develop. For example, we sponsor you for AWS certification.
* Good insurance and occupational pension conditions.
* Wellness allowance and access to office gym and swimming pool.
* Employee benefits through PostNord Plus - PostNord's own personnel foundation.
* Employment according to a collective agreement.


**We make everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless of if we lead ourselves or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at www.postnord.com.
   

  

**Apply**
 What are you waiting for? Welcome with your application!
   

  

 Note that we do not accept applications via email. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 For union representatives, visit: www.postnord.com/fackliga

title: Commerce Architect
description:
At our Song Commerce Customer Tech team, we are passionate about delivering transformative commerce experiences across the full customer lifecycle. As part of a globally renowned consultancy, we combine strategy, technology, and delivery excellence to help clients navigate the complex world of commerce. Our dedicated team of consultants specializes in advising on cutting-edge technologies and solutions tailored to meet our clients’ unique business needs, ensuring measurable outcomes.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Commerce Architect, you will play a pivotal role in bridging the gap between business strategy and technical execution. You will leverage your deep expertise in commerce technologies and architecture to design comprehensive solutions that not only meet immediate business needs but also align with long-term goals. This role requires both technical acumen and strategic thinking, as you’ll be responsible for guiding the architectural direction of commerce projects while also working closely with business leaders and technical teams to ensure the success of every solution.
   

  

 You will engage across the full project lifecycle—from early-stage solution design to post-implementation reviews—providing thought leadership and technical guidance. Your role will also involve contributing to business development efforts, supporting client Requests for Proposals (RFPs) with your knowledge of commerce technologies and architecture strategies.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
- Design commerce solutions: define the long-term vision and strategic direction for commerce solutions, conducting in-depth analyses to identify opportunities, challenges, and constraints throughout the solution lifecycle.

- Stakeholder collaboration: partner with business stakeholders and technical teams to elicit, understand, and clarify both functional and non-functional requirements. Ensure that solutions align with the business’s strategic objectives while addressing immediate needs.

- Architectural leadership: provide expert guidance in shaping solution architecture by translating business needs and technical requirements into detailed architectural blueprints. Assess and explain trade-offs between different design options, focusing on scalability, performance, and alignment with business objectives.

- Component selection: evaluate and recommend the right components for the architecture, whether they are off-the-shelf products or bespoke solutions. Compare options based on fit-for-purpose, cost, scalability, and time-to-market.

- Assessment and optimization: assess existing solutions, identifying gaps, inefficiencies, or opportunities for improvement. Provide actionable recommendations to elevate performance, security, and user experience.

- Solution development leadership: collaborate closely with engineering, development, and delivery teams to ensure that the solution is implemented according to the architectural design, adhering to both business goals and IT standards.

- Roadmaps and transition architectures: develop and maintain solution roadmaps and transition architectures that account for current technology landscapes while planning for future enhancements and emerging technologies.

- RFP support and business development: actively contribute to business development by supporting client RFPs with your understanding of commerce architectures, providing innovative solutions and technical expertise that align with client goals.

- Mentorship and knowledge sharing: serve as a mentor and thought leader within the organization, sharing best practices, fostering architectural thinking, and providing coaching to cross-functional teams.

**Professional Requirements**
- Commerce expertise: minimum of 2+ years of experience designing and delivering large-scale commerce solutions (B2B or B2C), with a focus on core business capabilities such as content management, customer identification, product management, search and recommendations, checkout, and payment.

- Technical integration: experience with system integration, ensuring seamless interactions between various commerce components. Proficient in working with API-driven architectures, data flows, and system interoperability.

- Performance and security: proven experience optimizing site performance and ensuring reliability, with an understanding of Content Delivery Networks (CDNs), caching mechanisms, and cyber security best practices.

- Composable commerce: familiarity with composable commerce landscapes, understanding how to integrate microservices, headless architectures, and cloud-native technologies to build flexible and scalable solutions.

- Cloud platforms: experience working with major cloud platforms such as Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), or AWS, ensuring that cloud-native solutions are fully leveraged for performance, scalability, and cost-effectiveness.

- Commerce platforms: knowledge of some leading commerce platforms (e.g., SAP Commerce, Salesforce Commerce, Adobe Commerce, Shopify, Spryker, Commercetools), as well as related capabilities such as Content Management Systems (CMS) like Adobe, Contentful, or Contentstack, and Product Information Management (PIM) systems such as Akeneo or Inriver.

- Solution architecture: demonstrated ability to develop solution architecture blueprints, driving the execution of solutions in multi-product team setups. Ability to take ownership of the architectural vision and provide clear direction throughout the project lifecycle.

- End-to-end delivery: experience managing the full lifecycle of solution delivery—from initial concept through design, build, deployment, and post-go-live maintenance.

- Technology trends: stay updated on the latest commerce technologies and industry trends, incorporating emerging technologies to enhance solution capabilities and create future-proof architectures.

- Education: bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, information technology, software engineering, or a related field.

- Agile mindset: experience working in cross-functional teams with an Agile approach, using methodologies such as Scrum or DevOps to foster collaboration and flexibility.

- Languages: fluent in English, both written and spoken.

**Personal Attributes**
- Customer-centric focus: demonstrate a customer-first mentality, keeping the end-user experience top of mind when designing and recommending solutions.

- Collaborative and proactive: a team player who actively engages with colleagues, shares knowledge, and contributes to a positive working environment.

- Communication excellence: ability to communicate complex technical concepts in a clear and compelling manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

- Adaptability: open to feedback, always seeking to improve, and willing to adapt your approach to fit new challenges.

- Quality and reliability: strong focus on delivering high-quality solutions that are reliable, scalable, and sustainable over the long term.

- Leadership and mentoring: ability to lead by example, offering guidance and mentorship to junior colleagues and contributing to a culture of learning and growth within the organization.

**Make your move now**
 Please send your detailed CV. We are continuously evaluating the applications.
